# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in split(text, ' ')
        word_length = length(word)
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
        current_line_length += word_length + 1
    end

    return strip(wrapped_text)
end

# Example
text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
wrapped = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped)
```

This function will print the given text, adding new lines to ensure no line exceeds 10 characters if possible (note that single words longer than the limit will not be split).
